channel.title: A bit of a problem, Could someone try at least to help
channel.description:
No matter what source I download, my client can never locate my main class client. Nobody also seem's to try to help, I'm not going to use this to release and make money off it, all I want to do is begin to understand java so I could develop skills into creating my own server,but can't even do the simplest of tasks such as get the client to run..Could somebody please help? Is their anything I'm missing?
This'll be the main error. [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/260900j.png[/img]
Here's my run.bat
@echo off title Client cd ./Class/ java -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32 pause
Here is my Client Folder. [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/14e9ufm.png[/img]
And here is my Class folder ( where my run.bat is supposed to locate my client.class) [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/28atb34.png[/img]

item.title: A bit of a problem, Could someone try at least to help
item.dc:creator: @ethanhello ethanhello
item.description:
@ethanhello wrote:

go to your c drive, then program files, then java and see what JDK version you have, if you dont have JDK then download it

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

also have you dont your environmental variables… that could cause this?

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=365374.0

Read full topic
item.source: A bit of a problem, Could someone try at least to help

Right is when I set it to jdk1.6.0_34

EDIT: same with jre6 and 7

item.title: A bit of a problem, Could someone try at least to help
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

ughh try

@echo off title Client cd ./Class/ "C:/Program Files/java/YOUR VERSION OF JDK/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32 pause

item.title: A bit of a problem, Could someone try at least to help
item.dc:creator: @hi_im_bamf hi im bamf
item.description:
@hi_im_bamf wrote:

I still get the same error, except this time it’ll just exit one cmd prompt and open another one that says press any key to continue…
I have team viewer, if anyone has the time for that.

Read full topic
item.source: A bit of a problem, Could someone try at least to help

item.title: A bit of a problem, Could someone try at least to help
item.dc:creator: @omfgamrange omfgamrange
item.description:
@omfgamrange wrote:

try adding START in front of java:

@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
START java -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

Read full topic
